tool_description: Evaluates fire hazards, combustible materials, ignition sources, and environmental factors to determine fire risk levels and protection priorities.

ignition_sources.description: Potential ignition sources in the building

special_hazards.description: Special fire hazards (chemicals, flammable liquids, etc.)

fire_history.description: Whether the building or similar facilities have fire incident history

ventilation_system.description: Type of ventilation system (natural, mechanical, mixed)

fire_load_density.description: Fire load density in BTU per square foot

error_messages: Invalid occupancy type: Must match recognized NFPA occupancy classifications.
Empty combustible materials list: At least one combustible material must be specified.
Empty ignition sources list: At least one potential ignition source must be identified.
Invalid fire load density: Must be between 5000 and 200000 BTU per square foot.
Invalid ventilation system: Must be natural, mechanical, or mixed.
Invalid special hazards format: Each hazard must be a descriptive string.
usage: Provide occupancy type, list all combustible materials and ignition sources present, and optionally specify special hazards, fire history, ventilation type, and fire load density. The tool will calculate comprehensive risk scores and recommend protection levels.

risk_category.description: Risk classification (Light, Ordinary I, Ordinary II, Extra I, Extra II)

critical_areas.description: Areas identified as highest fire risk

risk_factors.description: Key risk factors identified in the analysis
